item.title: Daniel Lakens
item.description: Neyman was an interesting character, and a very positive role-model for anyone working in statistics http://daniellakens.blogspot.com/2021/09/jerzy-neyman-positive-role-model-in.html

item.title: Russ Poldrack
item.description: Hey all, just moved over here from a generic server, nice to see you all!

item.title: Zebrafish Rock!
item.description: Gene expression atlas of the larval zebrafish brain. Credit to Inbal Shanier. #ZebrafishZunday

item.title: Russ Poldrack
item.description: @NicoleCRust @neurobuzz hey, thanks! No firm plans for another book right now (my stats book just came out: https://press.princeton.edu/books/hardcover/9780691250939/statistical-thinking). Thinking a lot about AI and cognitive neuroscience, and about philosophy of science stuff (i.e. can we really learn what we think we can learn from our data?). And cognitive ontologies - working on a grant for the next version of the Cognitive Atlas. How about you?

item.title: PsychoPy
item.description: A lot of people contributed to the most recent release of PsychoPy and PsychoJS.Made possible in part to the code sprint supported by @czi Thank you!#opensource #software #github #openscience #python #javascript

item.title: Kristian Harstad
item.description: People are getting paid for #publishing #AI-written #books, in an #author's name, when in fact the author did not, and knew nothing about this happening.Then, when the author tries to do something about it to stop this obvious #abuse, they are told no.

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description:
Changes in theta, gamma, and beta synch during working memory. More evidence for beta as a top-down control signal. Groovy.Task-specific oscillatory synchronization of prefrontal cortex, nucleus reuniens and hippocampus during working memory
https://doi.org/10.1016/j.isci.2023.107532

item.title: Dr. Anna Hughes
item.description: "Academia or industry?" Neither. I want to do this.

item.title: Daniel Hart Baker
item.description: @mick I had a great experience at Neurons, Behavior, Data analysis & Theory. Similar remit to JoN, but it’s a diamond open access overlay journal, so basically the future of publishing! Reviewers were constructive and pleasant:https://nbdt.scholasticahq.comFor human imaging work, Imaging Neuroscience is probably where it’s at these days:https://janeway.imaging-neuroscience.org

item.title: LWN.net
item.description: Another round of speculative-execution vulnerabilities https://lwn.net/Articles/940783/ #LWN

item.title: mekka okereke :verified:
item.description: The unspoken context behind the "Battle of Montgomery" video:* When media mentions "blue collar" jobs, they usually picture rural white folk. But... most employed Black and Latinx people work blue collar jobs, and most people live in cities. In the US, blue collar employees are Black and brown.🤷🏿‍♂️* Blue collar employees are often asked to enforce rules, (like mask mandates).* When racist white people get drunk, they often use slurs against, spit at, or physically strike these Black workers.

item.title: Thiago Carvalho
item.description: "The depiction of Africa as the place without history was the product rather than the cause of the enslavement and forced migration of over 12 million Africans, followed by the colonial conquest of the continent."https://www.nybooks.com/articles/2023/08/17/africa-the-center-of-history-born-in-blackness-howard-w-french/

item.title: Sarah Burstein
item.description: D514,277 - issued in 2006 for a design for a "chocolate chip." #DesignPatents

item.title: jordan
item.description:
Preprint from a small side project I worked on in the @kordinglab: A framework for automatic evaluation of open-ended questions, so that you can review course material on your own or enrich Jupyter notebooks with thoughtful questions!
https://arxiv.org/abs/2308.02439
#llm #preprint #jupyter #edutech

item.title: Amy Diehl, Ph.D.
item.description: New mom tracks the data finding time spent nursing, pumping and missing work when child care fell through was an average of 26 additional hours per week, turning eight-hour workdays into 13-hour days. A job that was unpaid and largely unseen. https://www.huffpost.com/entry/new-mom-track-baby-data_n_64bd7be7e4b093f07cb51742

item.title: Ember Manning
item.description: Hi Fediverse! I got laid off last week!I've got a PhD in Computational Linguistics and have been working for the last couple years as a Linguist on Google Assistant.My expertise is mainly in (a) linguistic annotation and (b) evaluation methods for Natural Language Generation (NLG). But I'm potentially interested in anything that will let me play with language data, or even language and/or data.I'm currently in the NYC area and would love to stay here, but I'm open to relocating elsewhere in the US, as long as it's not to one of the states that trans people are fleeing from.My mom said I should go back on Twitter to post about this, so getting me #FediHired would be a great way to prove that that's not necessary 😉#GetFediHired
